title: Myasthenia Gravis Activities of Daily Living (MG-ADL) Scale
description: Assesses disease severity and functional status in patients with myasthenia gravis by evaluating 8 activities of daily living commonly affected by MG symptoms. This patient-reported scale measures symptom impact on bulbar, respiratory, gross motor, and ocular functions.

parameters.name: talking
parameters.description: Difficulty with speech due to muscle weakness affecting vocal cords and mouth muscles

scoring.2: Constant slurring or nasal speech, but can be understood

parameters.name: chewing
parameters.description: Difficulty with chewing due to weakness of masticatory muscles

parameters.name: swallowing
parameters.description: Difficulty with swallowing due to weakness of pharyngeal and esophageal muscles

scoring.2: Frequent choking necessitating changes in diet

parameters.name: breathing
parameters.description: Respiratory muscle weakness affecting breathing function

parameters.name: brushing_teeth_combing_hair
parameters.description: Difficulty with arm elevation and sustained muscle activity for personal care

parameters.name: rising_from_chair
parameters.description: Difficulty rising from seated position due to proximal leg muscle weakness

scoring.3: Severe difficulty, cannot rise without help

parameters.name: eyelid_droop
parameters.description: Ptosis - drooping of upper eyelids due to weakness of levator palpebrae muscles

parameters.name: double_vision
parameters.description: Diplopia - double vision due to weakness of extraocular muscles

scoring.2: Double vision relieved by patching one eye

result.name: mg_adl_score
result.description: Total MG-ADL score ranging from 0-24 points with corresponding severity assessment

ranges.interpretation: Minimal functional impairment from myasthenia gravis. Normal or near-normal daily activities with little to no impact on quality of life.
Mild functional impairment with some limitation in daily activities. May require minor adjustments but generally maintains independence.
Moderate functional impairment with noticeable limitations in daily activities. May require assistance for some tasks and therapeutic intervention.
Severe functional impairment with significant limitations requiring assistance for many daily activities. Active treatment optimization needed.
Very severe functional impairment with dependency for most daily activities. May require intensive care, respiratory support, or nutritional assistance.

references: Wolfe GI, Herbelin L, Nations SP, Foster B, Bryan WW, Barohn RJ. Myasthenia gravis activities of daily living profile. Neurology. 1999;52(7):1487-9. doi: 10.1212/wnl.52.7.1487.
Muppidi S, Wolfe GI, Conaway M, Burns TM; MG Composite and MG-QOL15 Study Group. MG-ADL: still a relevant outcome measure. Muscle Nerve. 2011;44(5):727-31. doi: 10.1002/mus.22140.

Burns TM, Conaway M, Sanders DB; MG Composite and MG-QOL15 Study Group. The MG Composite: A valid and reliable outcome measure for myasthenia gravis. Neurology. 2010;74(18):1434-40. doi: 10.1212/WNL.0b013e3181dc1b1e.
formula: MG-ADL Total Score = Talking + Chewing + Swallowing + Breathing + Brushing teeth/combing hair + Rising from chair + Eyelid droop + Double vision (each item scored 0-3)
notes: The MG-ADL scale is an 8-item patient-reported outcome measure specifically designed for myasthenia gravis
Each item is scored from 0 (normal) to 3 (most severe), giving a total possible score of 0-24
A 2-point reduction in total score represents clinically meaningful improvement
The scale evaluates bulbar functions (talking, chewing, swallowing), respiratory function, gross motor function, and ocular symptoms
Administered based on patient recall of symptoms during the prior week
Easy to use, requires no special training, and can be completed in under 10 minutes
Correlates well with other MG severity measures including QMG score and MG Composite
Widely used in clinical trials and routine clinical practice for monitoring disease severity and treatment response
Each individual item score may be clinically significant even when total score appears low
